problem.markdown:
1. Consider the above diagram, GOS1, GOS2 represents isolators and CB1, CB2 represents circuit breakers. So when the transformer is required to take out for maintenance, what is the procedure: -
() None (x) Circuit breaker is taken out first and isolators are taken out second () Both Circuit breaker is taken out first and isolators are taken out second and Isolators are taken out first and circuit breaker is taken out second are true () Isolators are taken out first and circuit breaker is taken out second
2. The major difference between an isolator and a circuit breaker is that
() A CB is an off load device insulated to be opened only after current has been interrupted by some other after control device () Both A CB is an off load device insulated to be opened only after current has been interrupted by some other after control device and An isolator is an off load device intended to be opened only after current has been interrupted by some other control device (x) An isolator is an off load device intended to be opened only after current has been interrupted by some other control device () None
3. Essential features of switchgear are
(x) All () The switchgear must be able to discriminate between faulty and healthy section () The switchgear must be able to discriminate between faulty and healthy section () Provision for manual control and instruments
4. _______is used to make sure that an electrical circuit can be completely de-energized for service or maintenance
(x) Isolator () Circuit Breaker () None () Fuse
5. Switchgear consist of:
() Relay, control panels, metering panels () Lightning arrestors, current transformers potential transformer etc () Switched, Fuses, CB, isolators (x) All
problem.p: Consider the above diagram, GOS1, GOS2 represents isolators and CB1, CB2 represents circuit breakers. So when the transformer is required to take out for maintenance, what is the procedure: -

choicegroup.choice: None
Circuit breaker is taken out first and isolators are taken out second
Both Circuit breaker is taken out first and isolators are taken out second and Isolators are taken out first and circuit breaker is taken out second are true
Isolators are taken out first and circuit breaker is taken out second

problem.p: 2. The major difference between an isolator and a circuit breaker is that

choicegroup.choice: A CB is an off load device insulated to be opened only after current has been interrupted by some other after control device

Both A CB is an off load device insulated to be opened only after current has been interrupted by some other after control device and An isolator is an off load device intended to be opened only after current has been interrupted by some other control device
An isolator is an off load device intended to be opened only after current has been interrupted by some other control device
None
All
The switchgear must be able to discriminate between faulty and healthy section
The switchgear must be able to discriminate between faulty and healthy section
Provision for manual control and instruments

problem.p: 4. _______is used to make sure that an electrical circuit can be completely de-energized for service or maintenance

choicegroup.choice: Isolator
Circuit Breaker
None
Fuse
Relay, control panels, metering panels
Lightning arrestors, current transformers potential transformer etc
Switched, Fuses, CB, isolators
All
